title.narrative: MANAGEMENT AND STEWARDSHIP

description.narrative: Effective and transparent procurement of goods and services, contract management and supply monitoring to adequately support programme results., which contributes to Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Effective management of the supply and logistics functions to support the achievement of programme results, and efficient operational oversight and processes in place to strengthen coordination with the Khuvsgul office.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Effective and transparent procurement of goods and services, contract management and supply monitoring to adequately supportprogramme results.

description.narrative: UNICEF Mongolia effectively carried out sound partnership, financial and supply management through a regularly updated and monitored HACT assurance plan and Supply and Services plan. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: field visits conducted for programme and supply monitoring

actual.value: 2015:Completed. Total of 27 programme monitoring trips, which included a supply component where relevant, conducted in 2015.

title.narrative: of LTAs established in the office for common supplies and services to shorten overall procurement process

actual.value: 2014:Completed. Total of 3 LTAs issued: 2 for HACT micro-assessments and 1 for printing.

title.narrative: field visits conducted for supply monitoring

actual.value: 2014:On track. Total of 3 field monitoring trips conducted by Operations staff during the year. Key constraints were the restrictions in road travel and the deployment of the Supply & Logistics Assistant to support the Iraq (L3) corporate emergency for 3 months.

title.narrative: of LTAs established in the office for common supplies and services to shorten overall procurement process

actual.value: 2015:Completed. As part of the OMT workplan, a total of 2 UNICEF-led LTAs issued: 1 for office supplies and 1 for printing. An additional LTA on a fire safety assessment was assigned to UNICEF, however, this assignment was eventually completed via an official support mission organized by UNDSS.

title.narrative: % of Supply and Services Plan implemented and completed
% program field visits conducted for HACT programme and end-user supply monitoring
